intro: Tsaiodendron dioicum, commonly known as the mountain ash, is a deciduous tree native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves that are typically ovate or elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are a food source for various birds and mammals. Tsaiodendron dioicum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of both ecological and ornamental landscapes.
